title: RGUKT-Basar announces admission notification for 2024-25 academic year
keywords: rajiv gandhi university of knowledge and technologies
creator: Telangana Today
description: Varsity‚Äôs Vice-chancellor Prof Venkata Ramana and director Prof Sathish jointly released the notification in Hyderabad on Monday.
content: Home | Education | Rgukt Basar Announces Admission Notification For 2024 25 Academic Year RGUKT-Basar announces admission notification for 2024-25 academic year Varsity‚Äôs Vice-chancellor Prof Venkata Ramana and director Prof Sathish jointly released the notification in Hyderabad on Monday. By Telangana Today Published Date - 28 May 2024, 02:34 PM A view of Rajiv Gandhi University of Knowledge and Technologies (RGUKT) or IIIT-Basar Nirmal: The Rajiv Gandhi University of Knowledge and Technologies ( RGUKT ) also known as Indian Institute of Information Technologies (IIIT) Basar announced notification of admissions into various six-year-long integrated B Tech programmes for the 2024-25 academic year. Varsity‚Äôs Vice-chancellor Prof Venkata Ramana and director Prof Sathish jointly released the notification in Hyderabad on Monday. Venkata Ramana said that students could submit applications online from June 1 to June 22. He stated that a detailed notification would be uploaded on the website of the university soon. Students are advised to apply for admission online through TS online centre or Meeseva or University‚Äôs website www.rgukt.ac.in. They are requested to visit www.rgukt.ac.in or contact the university by email: admissions@rgukt.ac.in for more details. According to the authorities of the university, a total of 1,404 seats were reserved to candidates from general category, while 96 seats were going to be filled up candidates of special categories. A total of 105 seats have been earmarked to foreign students. Admissions into the first year of the Integrated B Tech Program would be carried out based on merit in the Grade Point Average (GPA) and Grade obtained in each subject of Class X. While OC or BC candidates should pay a fee of Rs 500, candidates from SC or ST are required to pay a fee of Rs 400. A sum of 85 percent of total available seats shall be reserved for local candidates, while the remaining 15 percent of the quota is filled up with both students of Telangana and Andhra Pradesh on the basis of merit, following the statutory reservations of the State. title: Leigh Matthews calls out AFL trend that ‚Äòdoes not make sense‚Äô
creator: Leigh Matthews
description: ‚ÄòClearly the umpiring philosophy must come from AFL head office.‚Äô
content: COMMENT Halfway through another AFL season and as always, the relentless evolution of the game throws up a few changing themes and trends. Clubs and players will attempt to get ahead of the curve. Some will succeed, most will fail. Know the news with the 7NEWS app: Download today Sydney with only one loss and a percentage of 150 are leading the competition and are clear trendsetters. On-field synergy is so important and the Swans have achieved this in spades. They have had 16 players who have played every game and have used just 27 players in total and only one debutant. Every club would envy this stability of on-field personnel. Then there is the developing trend of a ruckman becoming an extra big-bodied midfielder after the hit-out part of the ruck role has been completed. Brody Grundy is performing this role beautifully. Sydney‚Äôs midfield balance is suited to the modern game. With Grundy‚Äôs ground-level work, the grunt of James Rowbottom, Taylor Adams and the shutdown role of James Jordon, the foundation is being successfully built for the Swans classy and creative stars. AFL football is currently very congested around the stoppages but that means if the ball can be taken out of the congestion there is lots of space for the runners to work their magic. Again the Swans are leading the pack by using the open field to slice through their opponent‚Äôs zone defences. A core group led by Isaac Heeney, Chad Warner, Errol Gulden, Nick Blakey and Tom Papley have the speed and precision kicking skills other teams are unable to match. The evolution of umpiring particularly around the interpretation of the always contentious holding-the-ball seems to have taken another turn. Recently the balance between the rights of the ball carrier and the rights of the tackler have to a degree been rectified. Over recent seasons high contact and in the back free kicks have been rarely paid. To my eye this year at least the player with the ball has been given much more latitude and fewer holding the balls are being awarded. I‚Äôm quite happy with that umpiring evolution, although many disagree including the majority of the coaches. Damien Hardwick raised an interesting statistic from the Suns‚Äô loss to Carlton - there was 131 tackles but only 27 free kicks including only four for holding the ball. Dimma, clearly like many in the football fraternity, wants more tackles to result in a holding the ball free kick. Wouldn‚Äôt it be nice if the same urgency was given to better protecting the player in possession both when he is on his feet, or at the bottom of a pack with multiple opponents lying on his back. Much of this angst comes from the minimalistic trend in umpiring of paying vastly fewer free kicks than in previous generations. This is a trend that does not make sense. By way of comparison, in the last two games of the 1990 finals series there was an average of 79 tackles with 47 free kicks paid by the two umpires. So tackling numbers have doubled and free kicks have halved. With so few kicks being paid when an umpire awards a technical free kick, such as what happened late in the Fremantle-Collingwood game when Magpie Lachlan Sullivan gave the ball to teammate Nick Daicos and not the umpire for a ball-up and got pinged for time wasting, all hell breaks loose. Attempting to explain the rules of the game to a newcomer is quite confusing. When they then watch the game it appears there are no rules. The basic rules of our game are pretty simple, if the player hasn‚Äôt got the ball, you can‚Äôt tackle them and clearly that gets paid because they‚Äôre easy to see. You can‚Äôt make contact above the shoulder and that‚Äôs happening all the time, but not resulting in free kicks. And you can‚Äôt push a player in the back, and you can‚Äôt lie on his back but that‚Äôs happening all the time and isn‚Äôt being paid. Plus, this year, even holding the ball is rarely paid. It‚Äôs not the individual umpires. Clearly the umpiring philosophy must come from AFL head office. Before it was disbanded a few years ago the Rules Review Committee played a role in this process. A few times each season this group made up of umpires, umpiring management, AFL football manager and a handful of ex-players would meet to discuss the evolution of the game, particularly in regards to the rules and interpretations that influence umpires‚Äô decision making. Maybe resurrecting that committee would be a worthwhile initiative. What has also taken place in the season to date is the rare occurrence of a first-year teenager absolutely exploding on to the AFL scene. He might be only 19 and only played half a season, but Eagles prodigy Harley Reid has laid claim to being the most watchable player in the game. He‚Äôs such a phenomenon because he displays that enormous combination of strength, power, speed and skill. That he is so young and inexperienced is simply amazing. He oozes a confidence that makes him look like the big kid dominating in the schoolyard. Elite rookies often have a stack of confidence built on excelling in their junior days but opposition sides and the pressure of the intense competition usually gets the better of them eventually. So that‚Äôs the next phase that will come for Reid, who is so powerful at ground level. The fend-off has quickly become his trademark and he‚Äôs one of the few midfielders that can take a big pack mark. But what you do in your first half season is not what you‚Äôre going to do your whole career. There‚Äôs a lot of challenges to come and that doesn‚Äôt mean he‚Äôs not going to break the glass in all of them. I am not scheduled to be at any Eagles game this year and I wish I was because, like everyone else, I‚Äôd like to see Reid live. What he‚Äôs doing as a first-year teenager is remarkable. I have joined the Harley fan club. And the world‚Äôs his oyster. With next TV rights deal imminent the player salary cap will soon be around $20 million. During this decade there will be 50-odd players earning more than a $1m and the very elite probably earning more than $1.5m. In March, after the round one Giants-Collingwood match, I pondered whether Tom Green or Nick Daicos could be the first $2m-a-year players later in this decade. Reid should be added to that list.

content: Bedroom Drought: Not Having Lula Lula Causes Private Parts to Shrink and Become Elastic, Experts Warn Experts have warned that Gen Zers are not having lula lula as much as they should and this could hurt their body parts. According to experts, Gen Zers of legal age are having relations less than any other generation in history and this could lead to their private parts shrinking. Also read: Shurugwi Woman Pours Hot Cooking Oil On Her Husband For Starving Her Of Lula Lula Decline Lula Lula Among Gen Zers According to a recent survey by California University in 2021, 38% of people aged 18-30 reported not having relations in a year. Experts caution that abstaining from lula lula for extended periods can have detrimental effects on their genitalia. Dr Tara Suwinyattichaiporn, a sex and relationship expert, explained that most people need affection, touch, and sexual connections with others. Without these, mental health can deteriorate, leading to increased anxiety, sadness, and stress. Also read: A Deadly Concoction: Man Dies After Consuming Lula Lula Enhancing Concoction, Traditional Healer Arrested How Not Having Lula Lula Causes Private Parts to Shrink For men, prolonged lack of lula lula may result in a rare condition called penile atrophy. Dr Suwinyattichaiporn explains this occurs when the penile tissue becomes less elastic, causing a man‚Äôs joystick to shrink by 1-2 centimetres. Her warning was echoed by Tobias Kohler, an assistant professor of urology at Southern Illinois University, who states that without regular erections, a man‚Äôs joystick will lose elasticity and become smaller. In more severe cases, both men and women may experience vaginal/penile atrophy and pain during lula lula after going at least five years without intercourse. Additionally, lack of ejaculation may increase the risk of prostate cancer, as regular ejaculation helps flush out harmful chemicals that build up in semen. Also read: Married Woman Gets Juju From Madzibaba, Catches Her Husband Stuck During Lula Lula How Lula Lula Helps Prevent Prostate Cancer A 2016 study found that men who ejaculated at least 21 times a month had a lower risk of developing prostate cancer compared to those who ejaculated four to seven times a month. For women, lack of sexual activity can cause vaginal atrophy, leading to discomfort and pain during intercourse. Regular sexual activity increases blood flow, lubrication, and elasticity of vaginal tissues, preventing these issues. Experts continue to study the exact timeline for the development of penile and vaginal atrophy. Still, the consensus is clear: regular intercourse is important for both mental and physical health. title: Trump promises crackdown on pro-Palestinian protests if elected
description: Trump tells donors that the student demonstrators are part of a 'radical revolution' and promises to defeat them.
content: Trump tells donors that the student demonstrators are part of a ‚Äòradical revolution‚Äô and promises to defeat them. Former United States President Donald Trump has promised that he will crack down on pro-Palestinian protests on college campuses if he wins the 2024 US presidential election. Earlier this month, the likely Republican nominee told a small group of predominantly Jewish donors that he would expel student demonstrators, who he claimed were part of a ‚Äúradical revolution‚Äù, from the US if he is elected, according to a report by The Washington Post released on Monday. Keep reading ‚ÄúIf you get me elected, and you should really be doing this ... we‚Äôre going to set that movement back 25 or 30 years,‚Äù Trump said, according to the report, quoting people at the meeting who spoke on the condition of anonymity. The former president also praised the New York police for clearing the campus at Columbia University in late April, and said the other cities needed to follow suit, saying ‚Äúit has to be stopped now‚Äù. Student protests against the Israeli war on Gaza have rocked the US over the past few weeks, prompting a police crackdown on many campuses and more than 2,000 arrests. In mid-April, Columbia University saw a Gaza solidarity encampment, with students urging the institution to divest from companies associated with Israel. This movement spread to campuses in California, Texas, and many other states. University administrators accused pro-Palestinian demonstrators of using anti-Semitic language and creating an unsafe environment on campus. But students rejected those claims, which they said aimed to distract people from what is happening in the Gaza Strip. The majority of Americans below 30 years of age want a ceasefire in Gaza, according to a poll. During the donors‚Äô meeting in New York on May 14, Trump expressed his support for Israel‚Äôs right to continue ‚Äúits war on terror‚Äù and highlighted his policies towards Israel if he is elected. He has previously said Israel was ‚Äúlosing the PR war‚Äù with its actions in Gaza. ‚ÄúThey‚Äôre losing the PR war. They‚Äôre losing it big. But they‚Äôve got to finish what they started,‚Äù Trump said during an interview with conservative radio host Hugh Hewitt. According to the report, Trump did not mention Netanyahu, who provoked the Republican‚Äôs ire when he acknowledged President Joe Biden was rightfully elected in 2020. Israeli attacks on Gaza since the start of the war have killed more than 36,000 people, with 81,026 others wounded and thousands more missing, presumed dead under the rubble. Israel launched its assault on the besieged territory after a Hamas-led attack in southern Israel killed about 1,140 people.

title: Discovering Degas: Glasgow Burrell Collection hosts first exhibition since re-opening

description: Over 40 years, Sir William Burrell collected more than 9,000 pieces of art which he left to the city of Glasgow in 1947. title: Hard-liner Mohammad Bagher Qalibaf re-elected as speaker of Iran‚Äôs parliament
creator: Prima News
description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates ‚Äî Iran‚Äôs parliament re-elected hard-liner Mohammad Bagher Qalibaf on Tuesday as its speaker, reaffirming its hard-right makeup in the wake of a helicopter crash that killed the country‚Äôs president and foreign minister. Of 287 lawmakers voting, 198 backed Qalibaf to retain the position he first took in 2021. He initially became [...]
content: Iran‚Äôs parliament re-elected hard-liner Mohammad Bagher Qalibaf on Tuesday as its speaker, reaffirming its hard-right makeup in the wake of a helicopter crash that killed the country‚Äôs president and foreign minister. Of 287 lawmakers voting, 198 backed Qalibaf to retain the position he first took in 2021. He initially became speaker following a string of failed presidential bids and 12 years as the leader of Iran‚Äôs capital city, in which he built onto Tehran‚Äôs subway and supported the construction of modern high-rises. Many, however, know Qalibaf for his support, as a Revolutionary Guard general, for a violent crackdown on Iranian university students in 1999. He also reportedly ordered live gunfire to be used against Iranian students in 2003 while serving as the country‚Äôs police chief. In Tuesday‚Äôs vote, challenger Mojtaba Zonnouri, a hard-line Shiite cleric who once led the parliament‚Äôs national security commission, won 60 votes. A former foreign minister to hard-line President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, Manouchehr Mottaki, received five votes. Qalibaf offered no immediate remarks after the vote. The March parliament election saw the country‚Äôs lowest turnout since its 1979 Islamic Revolution. Of those elected to the 290-seat body, hard-liners hold over 230 seats, according to an Associated Press survey. A trained pilot, Qalibaf served in the paramilitary Guard during the country‚Äôs bloody 1980s war with Iraq. After the conflict, he served as the head of the Guard‚Äôs construction arm, Khatam al-Anbia, for several years leading efforts to rebuild. Qalibaf then served as the head of the Guard‚Äôs air force, when in 1999 he co-signed a letter to reformist President Mohammad Khatami amid student protests in Tehran over the government closing a reformist newspaper and a subsequent security force crackdown. The letter warned Khatami the Guard would take action unilaterally unless he agreed to put down the demonstrations. Violence around the protests saw several killed, hundreds wounded and thousands arrested. Qalibaf then served as the head of Iran‚Äôs police, modernizing the force and implementing the country‚Äôs 110 emergency phone number. However, a leaked recording of a later meeting between Qalibaf and members of the Guard‚Äôs volunteer Basij force, included him claiming that he ordered gunfire be used against demonstrators in 2003, as well as praising the violence used in Iran‚Äôs 2009 Green Movement protests. Qalibaf ran failed presidential campaigns in 2005, 2013 and 2017, the last of which saw him withdraw in support of the hard-liner Ebrahim Raisi. Raisi later became president and died in the May 19 helicopter crash that also killed Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian and six others. Iran‚Äôs parliament plays a secondary role in governing the country, though it can intensify pressure on a presidential administration when deciding on the annual budget and other important bills. Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, 85, has the final say in all important state matters. Iran will hold presidential elections on June 28 to replace Raisi. On Thursday, a five-day registration period for candidates will open.

title: UBS upgrades Autoliv stock, cites strong performance and margin expansion
creator: Investing.com
content: On Tuesday, global financial services firm UBS has upgraded Autoliv, Inc. (NYSE: ALV ) stock from Neutral to Buy and increased the price target to $141 from $102. The automotive safety systems manufacturer has shown a solid top-line outperformance relative to light vehicle production, with a 9 percentage point lead in the fiscal year 2023 and around a 6 percentage point lead in the first quarter of 2024. This performance is notably ahead of its peers. Autoliv's margin expansion has also been highlighted as a standout, with a projected increase of 170 basis points for the fiscal year 2024 over 2023. The company's strong balance sheet has been a contributing factor to its stock price rising approximately 15% year-to-date, outperforming the sector by 20%. The firm's financial health and growth have been key factors in the upgraded rating. UBS notes that Autoliv benefits from a degree of insulation from short-term sector concerns such as electric vehicle (EV) market penetration, intensive capital allocation needs, or underexposure to the Chinese market. These advantages position Autoliv favorably in the short, medium, and long term, according to the financial services firm. Despite Autoliv trading at a premium compared to its peers, it is still valued below its own historical price-to-earnings multiples. The company's 12-month forward P/E ratio is currently around 11 times, in contrast to its historical average of approximately 13 times. UBS finds the stock's valuation below historical levels difficult to justify, given Autoliv's record high margins. InvestingPro Insights Following UBS's upgrade of Autoliv, Inc. (NYSE:ALV) to Buy status, a glance at the latest InvestingPro data reveals a company with strong financial metrics that could underpin the firm's positive outlook. Autoliv's market cap stands at a robust $10.23 billion, and its P/E ratio is currently at 19.6, which adjusts to an even more attractive 14.79 on a last twelve months basis as of Q1 2024. This suggests a reasonable valuation relative to the company's earnings. The company's revenue growth has been impressive, with a 15.05% increase over the last twelve months leading up to Q1 2024, and a solid gross profit margin of 17.78% in the same period. Moreover, Autoliv's dividend yield is at a healthy 2.16%, with a dividend growth rate of 3.03% in the last twelve months, marking a continued commitment to returning value to shareholders. Notably, Autoliv has raised its dividend for 3 consecutive years and has maintained dividend payments for 28 consecutive years, according to InvestingPro Tips. For investors seeking additional insights, there are more InvestingPro Tips available, including the observation that 7 analysts have revised their earnings upwards for the upcoming period, signaling potential confidence in the company's future performance. To explore these tips and more, visit InvestingPro and consider using the coupon code PRONEWS24 to get an additional 10% off a yearly or biyearly Pro and Pro+ subscription. With 15 additional InvestingPro Tips listed, investors can gain a comprehensive understanding of Autoliv's investment potential. title: 'Simple' maths puzzle many people still get wrong - can you answer it?
creator: mirrornews@mirror.co.uk (Zahna Eklund)
description: A new brain teaser has been leaving people scratching their heads as they try to work out the next number in the baffling maths sequence - but the answer is actually quite easy
content: Working out the next number in this maths sequence might just make you tear your hair out. Keeping our minds healthy is just as important as exercising the rest of our bodies. One of the best ways to make sure your brain gets a good workout is to challenge yourself to a range of tricky brain teasers that force you to think differently. And while it might be some people's least favourite subject, a great source of these puzzles is maths. So if you're looking for a challenge today, why not give this puzzle a go? It should be "simple" to solve, but it turns out "many people" fail to answer it correctly. People struggle to work out baffling clock riddle - but some say it's easy Can you work out this puzzle? ( Image: quiz_riddles/Twitter) The puzzle was posted on X (formerly Twitter ) by the @quiz_riddles account, who wrote alongside it: "Many people will get this wrong. What is the answer?" The words were accompanied by a picture of the puzzle, which listed three seemingly easy addition sums, and a fourth one which had not been solved. However, if you look closely at the image above, you'll notice that the sums don't quite give you the answers you'd expect. Alongside 1 + 4 = 5, the puzzle claims that 2 + 5 = 12 and that 3 + 6 = 21. Finally, the puzzle asks you to work out what 8 + 11 should be. Now, we all know that in reality 8 + 11 is 19, but that's not the correct answer for this confusing brain teaser. Do you know what the solution should be? If you're still trying to work it out, don't scroll any further - as we're about to give you the correct answer! Answer The Chase's Darragh Ennis shares 'easy quiz question' which 'everyone gets wrong' 8 + 11 = 96. There are two ways to work this puzzle out. In the first solution, every sum after the first one is correct when you add the previous answer to it. So we know that 1 + 4 = 5, and in order to make 2 + 5 = 12, we must add the 5 from the previous answer. Likewise, 3 + 6 = 21 is correct if the full sum is 3 + 6 + 12. This does mean you have to do some extra working out between the sums, as you need to work out the values of 4 + 7, 5 + 8, 6 + 9, and 7 + 10 before you get to 8 + 11. But if you do it correctly, the full sum should be 8 + 11 + 77, which is 96. A quicker way of solving the puzzle is to do what I did and think outside the box. I noticed that while 2 + 5 doesn't equal 12, 2 x 6 does. The same is true for all the sums, including 1 + 4. If you flip the plus to a multiply and add one to the second number, every sum is correct. And 8 x 12 also gives you 96. Do you have a story to sell? Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror.com . Virgin Media offers gamers the chance to get ¬£250 but you'll need to act quickly

title: Babar Azam 51 runs away from breaking Virat Kohli‚Äôs world record ahead of 3rd T20I against England
creator: Abhishek Kumar
description: Pakistan captain Babar Azam is on the cusp of breaking a world record held by Virat Kohli in the 3rd T20I between Pakistan and England on Tuesday.
content: Pakistan captain Babar Azam is on the cusp of breaking a world record held by Virat Kohli in the 3rd T20I between Pakistan and England on Tuesday. New Delhi: Pakistan captain Babar Azam is on the verge of breaking a world record held by Team India star Virat Kohli in the upcoming third T20I against England on Tuesday, May 28. Pakistan will lock horns with England in the third T20I of the ongoing 4-match series between the two sides at Sophia Gardens in Cardiff. Pakistan will be looking to bounce back to winning ways to keep the series alive after a 23-run defeat in the 2nd T20I. While the first T20I was washed out due to rain, England successfully defended the total of 183 runs in the second T20I to go 1-0 up in the three-match series. The hosts rode on captain Jos Buttler‚Äôs brilliant knock of 84 runs to post a strong total on the board before their bowlers produced an excellent effort to bundle out Pakistan for 160 runs and wrap up a dominant win. Babar was the second-highest run-getter for Pakistan in the 2nd T20I as he ended up scoring 32 off 26 balls. However, the Pakistan skipper failed to notch up a big knock to take his team home. Babar is now on the verge of breaking an all-time record held by Kohli and will be looking to achieve the elusive feat during the third T20I in Cardiff. Babar needs only 51 runs to surpass Kohli in becoming the leading run-getter of all time in T20Is. Kohli has 4037 runs under his belt in 117 T20I matches for India whereas Babar has notched up 3987 runs for Pakistan in 118 T20Is. If the Pakistan skipper manages to score 51 runs in the third T20I on Tuesday, he will overtake Kohli in the elite list. Most runs in T20Is: Virat Kohli ‚Äì 4037 runs Babar Azam ‚Äì 3987 runs Rohit Sharma ‚Äì 3974 runs Even if he fails to notch up 51 runs in the third T20I, Babar needs only 13 more runs to become the first Pakistan batter and the second overall to complete 4,000 runs in the shortest format of the game. Babar has been one of the most prolific run-getters for Pakistan in T20Is ever since making his debut in the shortest format in 2016. Pakistan look to avoid series defeat against England After suffering a 23-run defeat in the second T20I, Pakistan will be looking to bounce back to avoid a series defeat against the hosts. With the first T20I getting washed out, a win in the third T20I will give England an unassailable lead of 2-0 in the four-match series. Pakistan batters will look to step up after their disappointing show in the 2nd T20I.

title: Mary Berry's 'creamy' stroganoff with a twist is 'cheaper' than traditional recipes
description: Stroganoff is a classic dish in British cuisine, loved for its creamy sauce. Mary Berry's version uses a cheaper cut of beef than traditional beef.
content: Mary Berry's 'creamy' stroganoff with a twist is 'cheaper' than traditional recipes (Image: Getty) Stroganoff works perfectly as a hearty winter dish or a lighter summer meal on a warm day. Traditionally, beef is the main ingredient which soaks up the delicious sauce; comprised of soured cream, butter, lemon juice and paprika. For anyone seeking a twist on the classic recipe , Mary Berry has the perfect alternative. Sharing her recipe with BBC Food, the chef claimed that "pork fillet is a really tender cut so great for quick-cook dishes". function loadOvpScript(){let el=document.createElement('script');el.setAttribute('src','https://live.primis.tech/live/liveView.php?s=114945&playerApiId=v114945');document.getElementById('ovp-primis').appendChild(el)}window.top.addEventListener('primisPlayerInit',e=>{try{if(e.detail&&e.detail.playerApiId==="v114945"){if(window.document.getElementsByClassName('jwplayer')[0]){e.detail.float('disable')}}}catch(e){}});window.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded',()=>{setTimeout(()=>{if(typeof flagTcfLoaded!=='undefined'&&flagTcfLoaded===!0){loadOvpScript()ExpressApp.Log('[Load] OVP flagTcfLoaded',new Date())}else{document.addEventListener("tcfLoaded",()=>{loadOvpScript()ExpressApp.Log('[Load] OVP tcfLoaded',new Date())})}},1500)}) Mary's recipe takes a mere 10-30 minutes to make, and the use of pork over beef means it "tends to be cheaper too". READ MORE: Air fryer sandwich with Italian flavours is ready in five minutes The stroganoff can be served with, potato, pasta, rice or just vegetables (Image: Getty) Pork stroganoff recipe Ingredients 400g pork fillet Two tbsp sunflower oil 25g butter One onion, finely sliced Two tsp paprika 225g button chestnut mushrooms, halved 140ml soured cream One tbsp lemon juice Salt and freshly ground black pepper To serve One tbsp chopped fresh parsley mashed potato Don't miss... Nutritionist shares simple and delicious picnic food ideas [EXCLUSIVE] Cook gorgeously golden air fryer roast potatoes in just 30 minutes [RECIPE] James Martin's chocolate cake uses a popular drink to make it 'incredibly moist' [BAKING] Method Cut the pork fillet into thin strips, around 6cm long and 1cm wide. Season the strips with plenty of salt and pepper, then prepare a large non-stick frying pan over high heat. Add a drizzle of oil when the pan is very hot, then add the meat and stir fry it "really briskly until browned" as put by Mary. The chef suggested that there should be no juices when it is cooked fast. That said, take care not to overcook it. Lift out the pork with a slotted spoon and transfer it onto a plate. Trending SUBSCRIBE Invalid email We use your sign-up to provide content in ways you've consented to and to improve our understanding of you. This may include adverts from us and 3rd parties based on our understanding. You can unsubscribe at any time. Read our Privacy Policy Put the butter in the pan, add the onions and cook over low heat until the onions are tender after about 10 minutes. Sprinkle in the paprika and stir in the mushroom, then turn up the heat and toss for a minute. Add the pork and cream to the pan and heat through. Finally, add the lemon juice and season everything with salt and pepper. Garnish the meat with the parsley and serve the mashed potato alongside. title: Lib Dems call for experts to sit on water company boards to improve transparency
description: Under the party‚Äôs plans, local environment experts within the community would sit on the water company boards as non-executive directors.
content: Local environmental experts should be represented on water company boards to ensure sewage spills are taken seriously, Sir Ed Davey said, as he accused Tory ministers of ‚Äúsitting on their hands‚Äù. The Liberal Democrat Leader is set to outline his proposals to hold the water industry to account during a visit to the Lake District today. Under the party‚Äôs plans, local environment experts within the community would sit on the water company boards as non-executive directors to ‚Äúimprove public accountability and transparency‚Äù. The experts would also be expected to hold community meetings to report back on action being taken. In the run-up to the General Election, the Lib Dems have unveiled plans to abolish Ofwat and introduce a new water regulator to tackle the sewage crisis, in addition to banning water CEO bonuses. According to the Environment Agency, sewage spills into England‚Äôs rivers and seas more than doubled in 2023 with 3.6 million hours of spills last year ‚Äì equal to about 400 years ‚Äì compared with 1.75 million hours in 2022. Sir Ed said: ‚ÄúWater companies are getting away with this national sewage scandal whilst Conservative MPs and ministers have just sat on their hands. ‚ÄúThese disgraced firms are destroying our treasured lakes and rivers with their filthy sewage dumping ‚Äì hitting human health, harming our precious environment and damaging the local tourism economy all at the same time. ‚ÄúEnough is enough. It‚Äôs time to get tough on the water industry and a key part of that change must be new ways to hold these firms to account, putting power in the hands of the local communities suffering from this scandal. ‚ÄúLocal environmental experts on company boards could hold water bosses‚Äô feet to the fire and local people would finally have a say in how their water company is run. ‚ÄúLiberal Democrats will have the boldest manifesto plans to end the sewage scandal ‚Äì from a tough new regulator to a ban on greedy exec bonuses to holding water bosses properly to account. ‚ÄúThis election will be about saving our country‚Äôs precious environment for the next generation, not least in special places like the Lake District.‚Äù Sir Ed is visiting the Lake District, where protests have taken place outside the office of water company United Utilities, after it was accused of pumping sewage into Unesco protected lakes. According to Liberal Democrat analysis of Companies House records, United Utilities has made ¬£2.3 billion in operating profits since 2019 and paid their top executives over ¬£2 million in bonuses.

title: Production Services Association announce Co-Chairs Liz Madden and Tom Rees
creator: Adam Parry
description: The PSA is delighted to announce Liz Madden and Tom Rees have recently been elected as Co-Chairs of the Council. Both Liz and Tom have been active council members of the PSA for a long time and bring a wealth of knowledge to the role. Their joint goal is to increase direct support for members and further evolve industry [...]
content: Liz Madden commented: ‚ÄúWe are looking forward to working with both council members and members to continue the growth and development of the PSA. The live industry faces ongoing challenges, and we will continue to provide support to members and the industry as a whole. Skills shortage is currently a key issue for the industry, and we are working on a training and education programme to address this.‚Äù Tom Rees added: ‚ÄúWe find great value in our long-standing experience on the council. By sharing Chair responsibilities, a PSA first, we can more effectively navigate during industry busy periods and continue to drive the success of the PSA, which boasts over 2300 members and grow this further.‚Äù Rejoining Liz and Tom as Officers are Keith Wood as Treasurer and Dave Bigg as Vice Chair. The PSA would also like to extend gratitude to Dave Keighley for his years of dedicated service as Chair. His contributions have been invaluable, and we are thankful for all he has done for the association. Dave will remain part of the elected council.

title: Learn a New Language With Over $400 Off a Lifetime Babbel Subscription, but the Deal Ends Today - CNET
creator: Adrian Marlow
description: A massive 76% discounts get you access to 14 languages with this amazing Memorial Day deal.
content: It's been a great few days for sales thanks to Memorial Day , and we're still seeing several retailers keeping some offers live. One of which is this fantastic one from StackSocial that provides the perfect incentive for learning a new language ‚Äì namely, a huge discount that knocks off more than $400 from the asking price. But be fast, as there's less than 24 left on this particular deal. A Babbel subscription can sometimes be an expensive purchase, but if you order now you'll get a lifetime subscription to all languages for just $140 . That's a 76% savings and one that won't be around for long, so make sure to take advantage of it now while you still can. Babbel is one of our favorite language-learning apps , offering a selection of 14 languages. It's easy to use, and its school-type experience helps you stick to your learning goals. Right now you can get Babbel at one of its lowest prices of all time, through a StackSocial deal that gets you a lifetime subscription to Babbel to just $140. That's 76% less than the usual price of $599, beating even the current discount you can get from Babbel by over 50%. This one-time payment gives you permanent access to an array of online courses across 14 different languages, which you can tackle at your own pace. If you like the sound of that, make sure you grab it quickly, because this is a limited-time offer that expires in less than 24 hours. Hey, did you know? CNET Deals texts are free, easy and save you money . Babbel's extensive language software includes Spanish, French, Italian, German, Russian, Swedish, Indonesian, Portuguese and more. The lessons are short and to the point, allowing you to practice in 10- to 15-minute intervals that can fit into any schedule. Real-life topics include travel, family, business, food and others. A variety of skill levels are available, ranging from beginner to advanced, so the program can grow with you as you improve. The speech-recognition technology will give you immediate feedback on pronunciation, so you don't just learn to read and write but how to listen and speak as well. You'll also get personalized review sessions to reinforce what you've learned. The program works across desktop and mobile devices. Although the internet is required most of the time, there is also an offline mode available where you can access courses, lessons and reviews without Wi-Fi, so long as you download them beforehand. Babbel also syncs your progress across your devices so that you can jump in from wherever is most convenient. Becoming fluent in a new language is a great way to stay engaged in learning , and the transferable skills you gain can open doors for leisure, work and beyond. Note that while you can access this program on as many devices as you want, this subscription offer is available only for new users. Babbel is great value when compared with other online courses, especially with this current discount. So whether you're a lifelong learner or just want to pick up some basics for your globe-trotting adventures, this is a solid deal. For more great deals around this price range, check out our roundup of the best Memorial Day deals under $100 . Read more: 11 Items to Add to Your Travel Checklist for a Smooth Trip

title: 'To leave after first round was not an ideal return', says Nadal after shock Roland Garros exit
creator: The Hans India
description: It was an emotional evening at Court Philippe-Chatrier as the 'King of Clay' Rafael Nadal made a shocking first round exit from Roland Garros after losing to Alexander Zverev.
content: Paris: It was an emotional evening at Court Philippe-Chatrier as the 'King of Clay' Rafael Nadal made a shocking first round exit from Roland Garros after losing to Alexander Zverev. Nadal‚Äôs legacy of record 14 Roland Garros titles is a testament to his sheer quality and industry on clay. At 37, the Spaniard has an illustrious career in tennis to look back at, as he moves closer to retirement which seems imminent, considering his injuries. Even as Alexander Zverev claimed a straight sets victory over the Spaniard, hearts went out to Nadal who, might as well, played his last match of the Grand Slam ever. "It‚Äôs going to be the last time I‚Äôm here in front of all of you. I‚Äôm not 100% sure, but if it was the last time, then I must say I enjoyed it. The feelings that I have today are difficult to describe in words. For me, it was special to feel the love of the people in the place that I love the most," said Nadal while addressing the spectators in the stadium. "I have gone through very tough two years in terms of injuries. I went through that recovery process only to be back at Roland Garros. To leave after the first round was not an ideal return. But I have to accept it. I was competitive and I had my chances. But it was not enough against a great player like Sasha (Alexander Zverev)," he averred. He did give the spectators something to cheer for while mentioning a possible return to Court Philippe-Chatrier for the upcoming Paris 2024 Olympics. "What you all have made me feel here, it‚Äôs unforgettable. I hope to see you again. Merci Beaucoup!" he conlcuded.

title: Central Bank says market interest rates should be reduced
description: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) states that there is a possibility to further reduce the market interest rates. MORE..
content: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) states that there is a possibility to further reduce the market interest rates. The officials of CBSL also mentioned that it is expected that the relevant reductions will be provided to the customers by the country‚Äôs financial institutions soon. Meanwhile, the Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL), Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe stated that although the financial institutions have reduced those rates, they have not been reduced to the same extent as the reduction of interest rates of the Central Bank. Speaking at a press conference today (28), he further stated that the interest rates for newly issued loans should be reduced. ‚ÄúThe changes that need to be made for the loans that have been issued by now will happen soon. We are keeping an eye on that. At the same time, we have seen instances where new loans area issued for higher interest rates. But that shouldn‚Äôt happen. We expect that change to happen soon,‚Äù he said.

title: Tools And Platforms For Your Day Trading Startup
creator: TI Partners
description: What is the hype behind day trading? Why is every other person talking about day trading? All we know is day trading means buying and selling financial instruments like stocks, currencies, futures, etc., but within a span of a single trading day. This is known to be the fastest way of trading but is considered [...]The post Tools And Platforms For Your Day Trading Startup appeared first on Tekedia.
content: What is the hype behind day trading? Why is every other person talking about day trading? All we know is day trading means buying and selling financial instruments like stocks, currencies, futures, etc., but within a span of a single trading day. This is known to be the fastest way of trading but is considered to be a potentially lucrative pursuit. It is not like a long-term investment, where you buy and hold the commodity till the time its price surges, and you sell it for a higher price. In this trading, you depend on the equipment (technology) you use to take a chance in the market in a timely manner. To make it simpler to understand, let‚Äôs give you an example of a Formula One racer racing in a rusty old car. Guess who will win the race? Obviously, the F1 guy. The old car racer needs a finely tuned engine to win the race, just the way a day trader needs an advanced set of tools and platforms to compete in the financial markets. For what purposes will the tools and platforms be beneficial for the traders? The technology you will use will help you with your day trading endeavors. It will help you access live market data, perform trades quickly and efficiently, analyze market trends, and identify opportunities. What Factors Add To The Success Of Day Trading? Let‚Äôs define a successful day trade before diving into the tools needed for successful day trading. A winning day trade involves entering and exiting a position within the same trading day, profiting from a price movement that aligns with your prediction. This can involve buying a stock at a low point and selling it later in the day at a higher price, or vice versa (short selling) if you anticipate the price to fall. To achieve consistent success in day trading, a deep understanding of the financial markets is paramount. This knowledge encompasses two key areas‚Äîunderstanding the market dynamics and technical analysis. Successful day traders develop a keen sense of how various factors influence market behavior. This includes economic data releases, company news events, geopolitical situations, and even investor sentiment. Technical analysis involves studying historical price charts and market indicators to identify potential trading opportunities. Day traders utilize various technical indicators like moving averages, RSI, and Bollinger Bands to gauge market momentum, support and resistance levels, and potential trend reversals. Knowledge alone isn‚Äôt enough. Successful day traders translate their market understanding into actionable trading strategies. These strategies outline specific entry and exit points for trades based on technical analysis and defined risk parameters. Here‚Äôs the crucial part: you don‚Äôt just develop a strategy and blindly follow it. Before risking real capital, successful day traders ‚Äúbacktest‚Äù their strategies using historical market data. This allows them to evaluate the strategy‚Äôs potential performance and identify any flaws before deploying it in live trading. The market environment is dynamic, and successful traders continuously refine their strategies based on experience and changing market conditions. Even with a deep understanding of the markets and a well-defined trading strategy, success in day trading hinges on two crucial factors‚Äîdiscipline and risk management. The fast-paced nature of day trading can be emotionally charged. Witnessing sudden price swings can trigger impulses to chase gains or panic-sell at a loss. However, successful day traders cultivate ironclad discipline. They adhere to their pre-defined trading plan, avoiding the temptation to deviate based on emotions. This means entering and exiting trades based on your strategy‚Äôs signals, not fleeting feelings of fear or greed. Risk management is the nail in the coffin of any successful day trading operation. Every trade carries inherent risk, and the key is to limit your potential losses. This is where stop-loss orders become essential. A stop-loss order is an automated instruction set with your agent to sell a security if the price reaches a predetermined level. By setting stop-loss orders on every trade, you establish a maximum amount you‚Äôre willing to lose on that particular position. While it might mean missing out on some potential profits, it prevents catastrophic losses that could wipe out your entire account. Successful day traders also utilize other risk management techniques, such as: What Are Some Essential Tools You Can Use For Day Trading? As we said earlier, one must equip themselves with the right resources to be a successful day trader. If you want to be well-equipped for day trading, follow our three-dimensional approach, which comprises reliable hardware, live market data feed, and a good trading platform. Let‚Äôs have a look at how these can help your day trading go from zero to millions or even billions. What do you perform trade with? A computer, so reliable computer hardware, means an engine of your trading machine. There are multiple checks to make to ensure that you have a reliable system to operate. To make the engine work, consider the following checklist: Just like a pilot needs real-time weather data to fly the plane safely, day traders depend on live market data to make good decisions. A good market data feed provides live quotes, breaking news, and market analysis. You need access to constantly updating stock prices, currency exchange rates, and other relevant market data. Some of the popular data feed providers are Bloomberg, Reuters, and IQ Feed. However, if you want to stay informed about market-moving news events further, you can gain valuable insights from technical analysis tools like Ethereum code offered by some data feed services. Do you know what a trading platform offers you other than currency exchange or commodities? Well, a trading platform acts like a central hub for executing trades. However, it further analyzes the markets and manages your portfolio on your behalf. Here is why you should consider a trading platform: You get access to the charting tools. The advanced charting capabilities will give you a detailed and effective technical analysis. You have to look for a platform that offers different chart types, technical indicators, and drawing tools to help you look for trading opportunities. Popular charting platforms like TradingView can be integrated with some brokers. To be successful in day trading you need a smooth way of order placement and execution. You must ensure your platform allows for various order types (market orders, limit orders, stop-loss orders) and fast order routing for swift trade execution. Some platforms offer built-in research tools like fundamental analysis reports, company news feeds, and earnings calendars, allowing you to make well-rounded trade decisions. Popular platforms with extensive research resources include TD Ameritrade‚Äôs Thinkorswim and Interactive Brokers‚Äô TWS platform. Some Popular Day Trading Platforms Having explored the essential tools, let‚Äôs discuss the best day trading platforms. Choosing the right platform is crucial, as it directly impacts your trading experience and efficiency. Here‚Äôs a list of some popular options: Summing Up Equipping yourself with the right tools and platforms is an essential first step for aspiring day traders. Reliable hardware, real-time market data, and a well-featured trading platform form the foundation for informed decision-making and efficient order execution. Remember, the ‚Äúperfect‚Äù platform doesn‚Äôt exist ‚Äì it depends on your individual needs and trading style. Beyond the tools, consider supplementing your knowledge with educational resources and joining online communities of experienced day traders. Continuous learning and a supportive network can be invaluable assets on your day trading journey.

title: Increased humidity exacerbates heat stress in Hyderabad and other Metros: CSE Report
creator: PTI
description: Summer time relative humidity has increased by 5-10 per cent this decade leading to excessive heat stress in Hyderabad and other metros. This increase is nullifying the drop in night temperatures in Hydeabad and Delhi too, a study by the Centre for Science and Environment says.
content: Home | Hyderabad | Increased Humidity Exacerbates Heat Stress In Hyderabad And Other Metros Cse Report Increased humidity exacerbates heat stress in Hyderabad and other Metros: CSE Report Summer time relative humidity has increased by 5-10 per cent this decade leading to excessive heat stress in Hyderabad and other metros. This increase is nullifying the drop in night temperatures in Hydeabad and Delhi too, a study by the Centre for Science and Environment says. By PTI Published Date - 28 May 2024, 02:33 PM New Delhi: Increased humidity is worsening the heat stress in Hyderabad and other metro cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, Bengaluru and Chennai. This particular phenomenon is even nullifying the marginal drop in air temperatures in Hyderabad and Delhi, says a report by the Centre for Science and Environment (CSE). The report says increasing concretization and humidity levels are exacerbating heat stress in India‚Äôs megacities, which are not cooling down at night at the same rate as a decade ago The Centre analysed summer air temperature, land surface temperature, and relative humidity data for six megacities ‚Äî Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai ‚Äî from January 2001 to April 2024. The think tank found that increased humidity is worsening heat stress across all climate zones, even nullifying the marginal drop in air temperatures in Delhi and Hyderabad. Barring Bengaluru, summertime average relative humidity has increased by 5-10 per cent in the other five megacities from 2014-2023 compared to the 2001-2010 average. The CSE report comes at a time when blistering heatwaves are affecting health and livelihoods in large parts of India. ‚ÄúAssessing the changing trend in heat, relative humidity, and land surface temperature along with day and night-time temperatures is necessary to develop a comprehensive heat management plan for urban centres,‚Äù said Anumita Roychowdhury, executive director of research and advocacy at CSE. Avikal Somvanshi, senior programme manager at CSE‚Äôs Urban Lab, said addressing the combination of high heat and humidity is particularly important as it can compromise the human body‚Äôs main cooling mechanism, sweating. ‚ÄúThe evaporation of sweat from the skin cools our bodies, but higher humidity levels limit this natural cooling. As a result, people can suffer heat stress and illness, and the consequences can even be fatal at much lower ambient temperatures,‚Äù he explained. The study showed that megacities are not cooling down at night. The land surface temperature during the summers of 2001-2010 would drop by 6.20-13.20 degrees Celsius from the daytime peak to the nighttime low. In the last 10 summers (2014-2023), night-time cooling has reduced to 6.20-11.50 degrees Celsius, the CSE said. ‚ÄúHot nights are as dangerous as midday peak temperatures. People get little chance to recover from daytime heat if temperatures remain high overnight,‚Äù Somvanshi said. ‚ÄúA study published in ‚ÄòThe Lancet Planetary Health‚Äô noted that the risk of death from excessively hot nights could increase nearly six-fold in the future. This prediction is much higher than the mortality risk from daily average warming suggested by climate change models,‚Äù he said. The study said that rising humidity levels have also made monsoons in Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, and Chennai hotter than pre-monsoon periods. It noted that all megacities have become more concretized in the last two decades, increasing heat stress. The CSE highlighted that an increase in green cover is not effective in mitigating nighttime heat. The study showed that Kolkata has the highest percentage of land under concrete and the lowest green cover among the megacities, while Delhi has the least area under concrete and the maximum green cover. Green cover has declined in Mumbai, Kolkata, and Chennai. The built-up area in Chennai has doubled in the last two decades, while its green cover shrank by almost 14 percentage points. Follow Us : Tags Climate change climate impact heat stress heatwave Related News USAID and Vignan‚Äôs Foundation collaborate to mitigate climate change UoH PhD scholar presents paper Telangana heatwave not over yet, IMD forecasts possible return post May 20 Hyderabad weather update: Light rain and thunder expected, normalcy to return

title: How your water bills could change if Ofwat stops firms hiking prices
creator: Joe Duggan
description: The industry regulator Ofwat is set to reject most water companies‚Äô requests to increase consumer annual bills, it is claimed
content: Industry regulator Ofwat is set to reject most water companies‚Äô requests to increase consumer bills, it has been reported. Ofwat is due to announce its draft decisions on its 2024 price review which will set the levels of service water customers can expect and the bills they will pay for 2025 to 2030. The announcement, which comes amid mounting public anger over water companies‚Äô handling of sewage pollution, will also include a decision on Thames Water‚Äôs bill increase and spending plans. What have water firms asked for? Water firms in England and Wales have reportedly declared they want to increase bills by between 24 per cent and 91 per cent over the next five years, according to a consumer watchdog. That is despite sewage spills into England‚Äôs rivers a nd seas more than doubling in 2023. Southern Water is asking for the biggest increase of 91 per cent, which would mean its customers‚Äô bills would rise from the current level of ¬£479 to ¬£915 per year, according to the Consumer Council for Water (CCW). South Staffordshire and Cambridge Water are requesting the lowest rise ‚Äì of 24 per cent ‚Äì which equates to a ¬£43 rise in their bills. What is Ofwat expected to say? A hotly anticipated review of how expensive water bills could be over the coming years has been pushed back because of the general election Ofwat has delayed publication of its decision on pricing until 11 July from an original date of 12 June. The consultation will see Ofwat give its initial verdict on water companies‚Äô business plans until the end of the decade, which it does every five years. But according to The Guardian , the regulator is poised to refuse most water companies‚Äô requests to raise consumer bills, with some getting only half of what they want. The regulator says the new price controls set as part of its 2024 review will still come into effect on April 1 2025, despite the later publication date for its draft decisions. What does this mean for bills? It‚Äôs not yet clear which companies have had their requests turned down or how much of their proposed bill increases have been rejected. But according to The Guardian , Thames Water‚Äôs request to increase bills by 59 per cent to ¬£749 a year have been rejected by Ofwat, with sources describing the firm‚Äôs business plans as ‚Äúfag-packet figures‚Äù and a ‚Äúmicrowave job‚Äù. They added that Thames Water‚Äôs board members were determined to ‚Äúsit on a deckchair on the Titanic‚Äù. A Thames Water spokesperson said: ‚ÄúOfwat has announced that its draft determination will be delayed until after the general election in July and so any comment about its content before that would be premature‚Äù. Why is Thames Water in trouble? The future of Britain‚Äôs biggest water firm, Thames Water , could hinge on the decision with the giant the most heavily indebted of England and Wales‚Äô water companies. When the company was privatised in 1989, it had no debt, but has since borrowed heavily. Thames Water has a roughly ¬£15 billion debt and, along with the other water companies, has become embroiled in a scandal over water pollution. It faces potential nationalisation after investors rowed back on a promise to provide extra funding, putting the company‚Äôs finances in the balance. Thames has asked Ofwat to allow it to hike customer bills over the next five years to help it invest in its infrastructure and balance the books. What about other utility bills? Households across England, Wales and Scotland are set to pay less on their energy bills from July after energy regular Ofgem has announced its quarterly price cap . Read Next How the 'triple lock plus' would affect your pension The average household energy bill is to fall by 7 per cent after Ofgem lowered its price cap in response to wholesale prices. The typical household‚Äôs energy bill is set to fall from the current ¬£1,690 a year to ¬£1,568. This will be ¬£500 less than the cap in July last year, when it was ¬£2,074, but Labour have pointed out it is still ¬£400 more than in 2021. And analysts have warned the regulator could increase the price cap on bills in October. The Tories have said they would keep the energy price cap in every year of the next parliament and introduce improved customer service to help consumers find cheaper energy bills and drive up competition. Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer has said, if elected, a government led by him would set up Great British Energy, a new publicly owned energy company, which would ‚Äúinvest in homegrown clean energy to boost energy independence and cut bills for good‚Äù.

title: Children‚Äôs Day: Harrysong Celebrates Daughters Amid Amid Marriage Crisis
creator: Pandora Peaceman
description: Nigerian singer, Harrysong has taken to his Instagram page to celebrates his daughters on Children‚Äôs day as he urged Nigerians to refrain from leaving negative comments on the post. content: Nigerian singer, Harrysong has taken to his Instagram page to celebrates his daughters on Children‚Äôs day as he urged Nigerians to refrain from leaving negative comments on the post. The artist who has been publicly addressing his marriage issues with his estranged wife, Alexer, for the past three days, shared a video celebrating their kids on Children‚Äôs Day. In the video shared on his page, the singer bought a cake for his daughters, mentioning that his eldest child always associates cake with birthdays. While wishing his daughters a happy Children‚Äôs Day, Harrysong emphasized that they deserve all the love in the world. He wrote; ‚ÄúAnytime Daviva see cake on the table or TV, na happy birthday o. Lol, Happy Children‚Äôs Day Daviva and Purity. ‚ÄúThey deserve all the love in this world. Today is their day. This post is monitored, pls no negative comments on this post,‚Äù

title: Spain recognising Palestine, Ireland and Norway follow
creator: Joseph Wilson
description: Three European nations are set to recognise Palestinian statehood as a rift widens between the EU and Israel, whose military operation continues in Gaza.
content: Spain has moved to formally recognise a Palestinian state with Ireland and Norway to follow suit in a co-ordinated effort by the three western European nations. / (min cost $ 0 ) or signup to continue reading Israel has slammed the diplomatic move that will have no immediate impact on its grinding war in Gaza but adds to international pressure on Tel Aviv to soften its devastating response to last year's Hamas-led attack. Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said the Spanish Cabinet will recognise a Palestinian state at its Tuesday morning meeting as a European Union rift with Israel widens. Ireland and Norway were also to make official their recognition of a Palestinian state later in the day. "This is a historic decision that has a single goal, and that is to help Israelis and Palestinians achieve peace," Sanchez, standing at the gates of the prime minister's palace in Madrid, said during a televised speech. Israel's Foreign Minister Israel Katz lashed out at Spain on X, saying Sanchez's government was "being complicit in inciting genocide against Jews and war crimes". While dozens of countries have recognised a Palestinian state, none of the major Western powers has done so. Still, the adherence of three European countries to the group represents a victory for Palestinian efforts in the world of public opinion. Relations between the EU and Israel nosedived on Monday, the eve of the diplomatic recognition by EU members Ireland and Spain, with Madrid insisting that the EU should take action against Israel for its continued deadly attacks in southern Gaza's city of Rafah. Norway, which is not an EU member but often aligns its foreign policy with the bloc, handed diplomatic papers to the Palestinian government over the weekend ahead of its formal recognition of a Palestinian state. At the same time, the EU's foreign policy chief Josep Borrell threw his weight behind the International Criminal Court, whose prosecutor is seeking an arrest warrant against Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and others, including leaders of the Hamas militant group. The formal declaration and resulting diplomatic dispute come over seven months into a grinding war waged by Israel against Hamas in Gaza following the October 7 Hamas-led attack in which militants stormed across the Gaza border into Israel, killing 1200 people and taking some 250 hostage. Israel's air and land attacks have killed 36,000 Palestinians, according to Gaza's Health Ministry, which does not distinguish between combatants and civilians. Last week's joint announcement by Spain, Ireland and Norway triggered an angry response from Israeli authorities, which summoned the countries' ambassadors in Tel Aviv to the Foreign Ministry, where they were filmed while being shown videos of the October 7 Hamas attack and abductions. Some 140 countries - more than two-thirds of the United Nations - recognise a Palestinian state. The addition of three western European countries to that group will likely put pressure on EU heavyweights France and Germany to think hard about their continued refusal to follow suit. The United States and Britain, among others, back the idea of an independent Palestinian state alongside Israel but say it should come as part of a negotiated settlement. Netanyahu's government says the conflict can only be resolved through direct negotiations. In his speech on Tuesday, Sanchez said that the recognition of a Palestinian state was "a decision that we do not adopt against anyone, least of all against Israel, a friendly people whom we respect, whom we appreciate and with whom we want to have the best possible relationship". He called for a permanent ceasefire, for stepping up humanitarian aid into Gaza and for the release of hostages that Hamas has held since the October 7 attack that triggered Israel's response. title: Transit of Goods via Iran Rises 56.5% in 2-Month Period
description: TEHRAN (Tasnim) ‚Äì The transit of goods through the Iranian land and territory in the first two months of the current Iranian calendar year (March 20- May 20) registered a 56.5 percent hike compared to last year‚Äôs corresponding period.
content: Some 3.641 million tons of goods were transited from the country in the first two months of the current Iranian calendar year. In this period, more than 1 million tons of goods were transited from the origin of the Parvizkhan Customs, accounting for a 29.5 percent share among customs offices in the country. Some 893,000 tons and 474,000 tons of goods were transited from the origin of the Shahid Rajaei and Bashmaq customs offices respectively. In this timespan, the largest amounts of the transited goods were registered from the origin of customs offices of Piranshahr, Sarakhs and Parvizkhan, respectively.

title: HONOR 200 series is official with 100W charging & much more
keywords: all the latest android & tech news
creator: Kristijan Lucic
description: HONOR has announced two new smartphones, the HONOR 200 series. The devices that were announced are the HONOR 200 and HONOR 200 Pro. HONOR announced the two phones in China, as this is their initial launch. Both are expected to launch globally too, though. The HONOR 200 series is official, and the phones are coming [...]Read More... from HONOR 200 series is official with 100W charging & much moreThe post HONOR 200 series is official with 100W charging & much more appeared first on Android Headlines.
content: HONOR has announced two new smartphones , the HONOR 200 series. The devices that were announced are the HONOR 200 and HONOR 200 Pro . HONOR announced the two phones in China, as this is their initial launch. Both are expected to launch globally too, though. The HONOR 200 series is official, and the phones are coming to global markets Chances are that both smartphones will be identical globally, but with different software, of course. So this initial launch does reveal all the detail that you may be wondering about. If you take a look at the two devices below, you‚Äôll see that they‚Äôre similar, but also different. You can easily tell which is which by their display holes. The HONOR 200 has a display camera hole, while the HONOR 200 Pro has a pill-shaped cutout on the display. Everything else is very similar, though. They both have curved displays with very thin bezels. There‚Äôs also an oval camera island on the back, in the top-left corner. Their backplates are rounded at the very edges. In regards to specs, these are mid-range phones, but very powerful mid-range phones... especially the HONOR 200 Pro. Let‚Äôs talk about that device first, shall we? The HONOR 200 Pro is fueled by the Snapdragon 8s Gen 3 SoC The HONOR 200 Pro includes a 6.78-inch 2700 x 1224 OLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate. That‚Äôs an OLED panel, by the way, and it gets immensely bright. It also offers a 3,840Hz high-frequency PWM dimming. The Snapdragon 8s Gen 3 fuels this smartphone, while HONOR offers 12GB and 16GB LPDDR5 RAM variants. Those two models come with 512GB and 1TB of non-expandable storage. It supports 100W wired and 66W wireless charging A 5,200mAh battery is included in the package, and the phone supports 100W wired charging. It also supports 66W wireless charging. Android 14 comes pre-installed with MagicOS 8.0 on top of it. A 50-megapixel main camera (OmniVision OV50H sensor, f/1.9 aperture, OIS), is backed with a 12-megapixel ultrawide camera (112-degree FOV, 2.5cm macro camera), and a 50-megapixel telephoto unit (Sony‚Äôs IMX856 sensor, 2.5x optical zoom, OIS). An in-display fingerprint scanner is also a part of the package. The phone also includes a set of stereo speakers, and Bluetooth 5.3. It measures 163.3 x 75.2 x 8.2mm and weighs 199 grams. The HONOR 200 Pro‚Äôs pricing starts at CNY3,499 ($483) in China. The HONOR 200 has a 120Hz display & Snapdragon 7 Gen 3 chip The vanilla HONOR 200, on the flip side, has a 6.7-inch 2664 x 1200 OLED display. That panel is also curved, and it also has a 120Hz refresh rate. It gets just as bright as the HONOR 200 Pro panel, and it has the same 3,840Hz high-frequency PWM dimming. The Snapdragon 7 Gen 3 fuels this smartphone, while both 12GB and 16GB LPDDR5 RAM models are available. Those two variants include 256GB and 512GB of internal storage, respectively. A 5,200mAh battery is included, and 100W wired charging supported A 5,200mAh battery sits inside this phone, and the device supports 100W wired charging. Android 14 comes pre-installed, along with MagicOS 8.0. This handset also includes an in-display fingerprint scanner and a set of stereo speakers. A 50-megapixel main camera (Sony‚Äôs IMX906 sensor, f/1.95 aperture, OIS) is backed by a 12-megapixel ultrawide unit (112-degree FOV, 2.5cm macro option), and a 50-megapixel telephoto camera (Sony‚Äôs IM856 sensor, 2.5x optical zoom, OIS). The HONOR 200 measures 161.5 x 74.6 x 7.7mm, and it weighs 187 grams. Its pricing starts at CNY2,699 ($373) in China.
