title: ‚Äú·Ñã·Öµ·Ñâ·Ö≥·ÑÖ·Ö°·Ñã·Ö¶·ÜØ·ÑÄ·ÖÆ·Ü´ ·Ñê·Ö¢·Üº·Ñè·Ö≥, ·ÑÖ·Ö°·Ñë·Ö° ·ÑÉ·Ö©·Ñâ·Öµ·Ü∑ ·Ñå·Öµ·Ü´·Ñã·Öµ·Ü∏‚Äù
How the rise of PH volleyball has put the sport on a pedestal
description: MANILA, Philippines ‚ÄîFrom holding the game in small university gyms to hosting a Finals series with an average of more than 20,000 spectators, the Premier Volleyball League‚Äìand, in turn, the sport of volleyball‚Äìhas come a long way in the Philippines. This was what longtime organizer Sports Vision had envisioned since it founded the Shakey‚Äôs V-League‚Äìwhere
content: Now and then: from holding the Shakey‚Äôs V-League games to small venues to record-breaking attendance, the PVL‚Äìand Philippine volleyball‚Äìare certainly on the rise. MANILA, Philippines ‚ÄîFrom holding the game in small university gyms to hosting a Finals series with an average of more than 20,000 spectators, the Premier Volleyball League‚Äìand, in turn, the sport of volleyball‚Äìhas come a long way in the Philippines. This was what longtime organizer Sports Vision had envisioned since it founded the Shakey‚Äôs V-League‚Äìwhere PVL traces its roots that started primarily as a collegiate preseason league‚Äìin 2004, and seeing drones of fans come to the PVL games now has left president Ricky Palou in awe of how volleyball in the country has evolved. ‚ÄúI remember if there were at leastm50 people watching, we‚Äôd already be so happy,‚Äù Palou told Inquirer following the success of the 2024 season‚Äôs first conference‚Äìwhich drew record-breaking numbers in live spectators during the PVL Finals. READ: Looking back at PVL‚Äôs ‚Äòvery successful‚Äô 2023 ‚ÄúWe started in 2004. There were few fans, but we noticed that slowly the number of spectators increased. Now we‚Äôre reaching 20,000 to 24,000. We‚Äôre happy about this.‚Äù Numbers, as they say, don‚Äôt lie and these record-setting crowd counts in the PVL can only be considered a testament to the continued rise of volleyball in the country. This photo of Philippine Army Lady Troopers celebrating the of the 2011 Shakey‚Äôs V-League Open Conference shows the beginnings of club volleyball competition in the Philippines. ‚ÄìAUGUST DELA CRUZ It all started when Sports Vision Management Group ventured into the volleyball scene with the Shakey‚Äôs V-League, which featured college teams playing at Lyceum, Blue Eagle Gym, and Rizal Memorial Coliseum in the mid-2000s. Eventually, club teams and military squads joined to form the Open Conference before the league was rebranded as the PVL in 2017. The league continued to grow with current clubs Creamline, the most successful with eight titles, Petro Gazz, and Choco Mucho with games now being regularly played FilOil EcoOil Centre in San Juan, Philsports Arena, and Mall of Asia Arena. READ: ‚ÄòRight time‚Äô to turn pro for PVL; players excited The PVL decided to turn professional in 2020, making it the first volleyball league in the country with pro status, and drew defunct Philippine Superliga teams like Cignal, PLDT, and Chery Tiggo. The first-ever pro tournament inside the bubble in Bacarra, Ilocos Norte was ruled by the Crossovers, led by sisters Jaja and Dindin Santiago-Manabat, after beating the Cool Smashers behind closed doors at PCV Socio-Civic and Cultural Center. When the COVID-19 restrictions were slowly lifted, the PVL returned in 2022 with a semi-bubble setup at Paco Arena until it received a go signal to open its doors to the fans at FilOil and MOA Arena, thus signaling the rise of Philippine volleyball. Teams have come and go since then, but the PVL eventually managed to put up a 12-team field with Akari, Nxled, Farm Fresh, Strong Group Athletics, Capital1, and Galeries Tower joining the fray. A general view of the record PVL crowd during Game 2 of the Finals between Creamline and Choco Mucho at Araneta Coliseum. ‚ÄìPVL PHOTO The PVL shattered the Philippine volleyball attendance record after 24,459 fans watched Creamline‚Äôs title-clinching Game 2 win over Choco Mucho at the Big Dome last December in the second All-Filipino Conference, surpassing the previous high of 22,848 spectators between Ateneo and La Salle in the 2016 UAAP finals at the same venue. Creamline and Choco Mucho, two of the PVL‚Äôs most popular teams, met again for the second straight All-Filipino Finals and it was no surprise that the last game of the series came just over a 1,000 spectators short of the record with a 23,162 crowd count at Araneta Coliseum. READ: Just like the All-Filipino title, PVL attendance record stays put Seeing packed crowds even on a weekday, though, have become a common sight for the PVL, especially during the playoffs, with the championship opener drawing 17,457 supporters on a Thursday evening also at the Big Dome. On the final day of the semis last May 5, Close to 18,000 fans attended the game day when Creamline beat Chery Tiggo to return to the finals and Choco Mucho completed a three-game sweep after eliminating Petro Gazz. This was despite PVL‚Äôs simultaneous schedule with the PBA and the Final Four game between UST and La Salle in the UAAP Season 86 women‚Äôs volleyball tournament where 19,505 spectators came to see the Tigresses dethrone the Lady Spikers to end a five-year Finals drought. PVL‚Äôs final semis game started at 7:03 p.m. and ended at 9:11 p.m. whie the UST-La Salle match was played from 6:09 p.m. to 9:01 p.m. Palou and the organizers are honored to receive such a huge following from Filipino sports fans, who have been taking the PVL to greater heights as one of the main sports in the country. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre amazed at how the fans have come to like volleyball and appreciate the game of volleyball. I guess they find it exciting so we‚Äôre very happy and elated that the number of volleyball fans is increasing,‚Äù said the Sports Vision president. Celebrities like Vice Ganda and Willie Revillame, PBA players, other Filipino athletes, and other personalities have been part of PVL‚Äôs enthusiasm over the past two years. A game between the PVL‚Äôs biggest crowd draws‚ÄìChoco Mucho Flying Titans and Creamline Cool Smashers‚Äìin the PVL All-Filipino Conference Finals. ‚ÄìMARLO CUETO/INQUIRER.nbet More than the skills and charisma of the league‚Äôs fan favorites like Alyssa Valdez, Jema Galanza, Deanna Wong, Sisi Rondina, Mika Reyes, Eya Laure, and other stars, Palou believes the formula for the PVL‚Äôs continuous rise is the excitement and intensity of the games and the parity of the competition. ‚ÄúFans what to see good games between teams and everything is fair and transparent, that‚Äôs the formula there, ‚Äù Palou said. ‚ÄúThey come to watch because they enjoy the games.‚Äù ‚ÄúIn the last championship game, I was sitting beside a lady I asked: ‚ÄòWho are you rooting for her, Choco Mucho or Creamline?‚Äô She said, ‚Äò‚ÄôSir, I‚Äôm cheering for Creamline.‚Äô But when Choco Mucho scores, she would still cheer,‚Äù he added. READ: PVL: Creamline, Choco Mucho grateful for overwhelming support from fans ‚ÄúSo I said, ‚ÄòI thought you were cheering from Creamline?‚Äô She said: ‚ÄòSir as long as the plays and hits are good, we‚Äôre also excited.‚Äô It‚Äôs exciting. They like a good match.‚Äù But as the league grows, so do the expectations to keep the level of competition high and the audience engaged‚Äìwhich is what the PVL is looking to address as soon as possible. A good place to start would be a Rookie Draft. ‚ÄúWe just wanted to make sure that everything would be fair. Because we‚Äôre transparent, we don‚Äôt really want one team to dominate, we‚Äôd like all to be competitive and everybody will have a chance to win a championship. What we‚Äôre really looking at really is the fair officiating and everything,‚Äù Palou said. ‚ÄúWhat we‚Äôd like to see is the other clubs make their teams more competitive so that all games can attract a good number of spectators. Now what you see is if they know the game will be on sided, fans tend now to attend. What we really want is all teams will be very competitive.‚Äù READ: PVL looks to address player tampering to preserve league harmony In the first rookie Draft set for July 6, the college stars and other aspirants are expected to boost the rosters of the bottom four, Strong Group Athletics, Capital1, Galeries Tower, and Farm Fresh. The move was borne out of recent developments in the PVL when the more established teams pulled off off recruitment sprees and signed young collegiate stars who were still far from using up their eligibilities in the collegiate leagues. Packed crowds for both the PVL and UAAP volleyball games has PNVF saying that volleyball is now the Philippines‚Äô top sport. At the rate that the fanbases of the teams in the PVL are growing and how venues are filled for the games also in the UAAP volleyball tournaments, Philippine National Volleyball Federation president Tats Suzara claimed that volleyball has already surpassed basketball as the country‚Äôs top sport. ‚ÄúVolleyball is now the number one sport among spectators in the Philippines, not basketball. I said this to boss MVP (Manny V. Pangilinan), and he said, ‚Äòthat‚Äôs a lot, 46 thousands [fans] in one day?'‚Äù said Suzara. ‚ÄúSo I told him, volleyball is a family entertainment sport All ages, families, boyfriends-girlfriends, father and mother. So I think, it‚Äôs a sport that‚Äôs really made for families,‚Äù said Suzara. ‚ÄúIf you will see the difference, in my experience, the basketball ‚Äî Fiba World Cup was more on the players‚Äô experience. But for volleyball, it‚Äôs the fan experience. Players cooperate with the fans, they welcome interviews. So I think it makes volleyball now the number one sport in the world and the Philippines, of course,‚Äù he added. And the Philippines‚Äô latest success in the AVC Challenge Cup, where the newly-named Alas Pilipinas women‚Äôs squad has made history, has only added to the interest of the nation in volleyball. The tightly knit Alas Pilipinas celebrates a four-set win over Iran in the AVC Challenge Cup 2024 Saturday night. ‚ÄîMARLO CUETO/INQUIRER.net Despite limited preparation, Alas Pilipinas swept four games in Pool A to reach the semifinals ‚Äî the farthest a Philippine team reached since joining the tournaments of the Asian Confederation in 1961. The young Alas Pilipinas, led by captain Jia De Guzman and go-to scorer Angel Canino, won their games in front of electric 5,000 fans at Rizal Memorial Coliseum every night despite the rainy weather in their last two games. The tickets for the Philippines‚Äô semifinal game against Kazakhstan on Tuesday were sold out as the Filipino Spikers hope to make a historic entry to the Final. READ: For just P15,000 each to play, Alas Pilipinas earns fans‚Äô hearts This is exactly how Palou thinks volleyball can solidify itself as the Philippines‚Äô no. 1 sport‚Äìthrough excellence in international tournaments‚Äìand the country may have just taken the first step towards that. ‚ÄúIf we do relatively well in the international scene, if we can be competitive in AVC tournaments we think it will improve the following of volleyball. Our target is for the national team to do well in the next Southeast Asian Games, which is next year,‚Äù Palou said. The last time the women‚Äôs squad won a Southeast Asian Games medal was in 2005, while the men‚Äôs players earned a historic silver medal in the 2019 edition. Subscribe to our daily newsletter By providing an email address. I agree to the Terms of Use and acknowledge that I have read the Privacy Policy . ‚ÄúAs early as now we‚Äôre hoping that this team will stay together and develop into a really, really good team with 14 players. We‚Äôre looking at 20 to 24 players so that if there‚Äôs injury, we can have a replacement right away and they train together all the time,‚Äù Palou said.

title: Grandfather marries 102-year-old girlfriend in retirement home ceremony
creator: The Insidexpress
description: Marjorie, 102, and Bernie, 100, tied the knot after nearly a decade (Picture: Sarah Sicherman) Centenarian couple Marjorie Fiterman,102, and Bernie Littman, 100, married each other on May 19, after...
content: Marjorie, 102, and Bernie, 100, tied the knot after nearly a decade (Picture: Sarah Sicherman) Centenarian couple Marjorie Fiterman,102, and Bernie Littman, 100, married each other on May 19, after meeting in their care home nearly a decade ago. The couple, who have a combined age of 202 years, may have broken a Guinness World Record. The previous record holders, according to Fox News, belonged to Doreen and George Kirby of England, who had a combined age of 194 years when they wed on June 13, 2015. The Philadelphia newlyweds have proved it‚Äôs never too late to tie the knot, and their families are very happy for them. Bernie‚Äôs granddaughter, Sarah Sicherman, told Fox News it was great that he had found a companion ‚Äòto do activities and spend time with‚Äô. She said they were ‚Äòso lucky to have found each other‚Äô and that they supported each other well throughout the pandemic. Marjorie and Bernie getting married on May 19 (Picture: Sarah Sicherman facebook) Writing on Facebook, Sarah said: ‚ÄòNext week my 100-year-old grandfather is marrying his 102-year-old girlfriend! ‚ÄòThis unique celebration, marking a century of memories and more, promises to be an unforgettable day filled with love, laughter, and a testament to timeless affection. Mazal tov!‚Äô Bernie had previously been married to Bernice for 65 years, who passed away in 2012. A few years later he then met Marjorie at a costume party and the pair ended up having their first date on the same day his great-granddaughter was born. His family said his plans to marry Marjorie had been a ‚Äòsurprise‚Äô as they ‚Äòassumed they would just live out their days status quo‚Äô. Marjorie and Bernie met in their care home nearly a decade ago (Picture: Sarah Sicherman facebook) The Rabbi, Adam Wohlberg, who married the couple, said to Fox News, the pair got to the point ‚Äòwhere being not just close friends ‚Äì but husband and wife ‚Äì felt like the right step to take‚Äô. He didn‚Äôt give them any marriage advice at the ceremony because they already had a wealth of experience in that department. The Rabbi said: ‚ÄòI think it is safe to say each of you, what you know and understand about each other, is exactly what the future holds for you and your partner. And what you have determined you love about each other ‚Äì well, those things are not about to change.‚Äô Marjorie had been married to her husband Morris before he passed away in 1999, but knew ‚Äòsomeone incredibly special had come into [her] life‚Äô when she met Bernie. Read More Stories There‚Äôs a chance the newlyweds crossed paths decades earlier when they were both students at the University of Pennsylvania, studying at the same time. Marjorie and Bernie went to the same university ‚Äì the University of Pennsylvania ‚Äì but never knew each other (Picture: Sarah Sicherman facebook) With different degrees in different departments, they didn‚Äôt know of each other when they were there though. Their Rabbi joked the pair may make the cover of the university‚Äôs alumni magazine when the next edition comes out. Bernie‚Äôs daughter Sarah also commented on the couple‚Äôs Guinness World Record application, saying it was ‚Äòpending,‚Äô but that she and her family believe the newlyweds are the ‚ÄòOldest Aggregate Age Couple to Marry, by about eight years‚Äô. Do you have a story to share? Get in touch by emailing MetroLifestyleTeam@Metro.co.uk. Publisher

title: S. Korea finance chief hints at tax incentives for local firms
description: The South Korean government is ramping up discussions on specific tax incentives aimed at enhancing the market value of local companies, with plans to conduct public hearings over the next two months. ‚ÄúWe talked about tax incentives for the Value-up Program on several occasions. But now is the time for us to discuss more specific
content: The South Korean government is ramping up discussions on specific tax incentives aimed at enhancing the market value of local companies, with plans to conduct public hearings over the next two months. ‚ÄúWe talked about tax incentives for the Value-up Program on several occasions. But now is the time for us to discuss more specific plans,‚Äù Finance Minister and Deputy Prime Minister Choi Sang-mok told reporters on Monday. ‚ÄúThroughout June and July, we will host public hearings to deliberate specific tax incentives,‚Äù Choi said. The government‚Äôs Corporate Value-up Program aims to incentivize listed firms to bolster their value, thereby improving their market value and addressing the so-called ‚ÄúKorea discount‚Äù issue. ‚ÄúKorea discount‚Äù refers to Korean companies being seen as comparatively undervalued due to various factors. However, the recent release of a vague guideline lacking binding force and specific incentives to boost participation has drawn criticism. READ: South Korea proposes tax cuts to stimulate corporate investment Choi mentioned that the hearings will cover various incentives discussed in the market, including separate taxation of dividend income, corporate tax credits for increased dividends, and the abolition of inheritance tax surcharges for major shareholders. ‚ÄúFrom the perspective of the effectiveness of incentives, the more benefits, the better. However, an excess could compromise fairness. We‚Äôll strive to strike a balance,‚Äù he emphasized. The top finance policymaker revealed that the open hearings will occur two to three times over the next two months. In the initial session, options will be refined, with subsequent discussions aimed at finalizing incentive details. Choi also noted that discussions on inheritance tax will be included in the hearings. South Korea has the world‚Äôs second-highest inheritance tax rate at 50 percent, with a 20 percent ‚Äúmanagement premium‚Äù surcharge for major stakeholders at large firms, elevating the rate to the world‚Äôs highest, at 60 percent. ‚ÄúIn regard to the inheritance tax law, there are various proposals, from eliminating the surcharge for major shareholders to expanding family business inheritance deductions and enhancing benefits for Value-up companies,‚Äù he explained. ‚ÄúWe will narrow down options through public hearings and incorporate them into the tax law amendment.‚Äù READ: S. Korea readies financial support for small businesses, builders Monday‚Äôs briefing marked Choi‚Äôs inaugural monthly press conference, a move aimed at enhancing communication with the media and the public. During the session, he addressed various queries, including clarifying the government‚Äôs position on the short-selling ban. ‚ÄúTo reintroduce short selling, we need regulatory enhancements to combat illegal practices, including the implementation of a monitoring system,‚Äù he emphasized. ‚ÄúWith the ban set to continue until June, we aim to clarify our resumption plans by the end of the month for market stability. Earlier that day, Financial Supervisory Service Governor Lee Bok-hyun suggested that the short-selling monitoring system‚Äôs development could conclude in the first quarter of next year, suggesting a potential lift of the ban around that time. Choi also disclosed the government‚Äôs plans to support the growth of small and medium-sized enterprises by extending the period for receiving benefits from three years to five years. Additional measures to assist them post-extension will also be introduced. These measures will be unveiled in early June as part of the government‚Äôs ‚Äúdynamic economy road map,‚Äù outlining its economic policy vision. Regarding inflation, Choi reiterated the government‚Äôs positive outlook. Subscribe to our daily newsletter By providing an email address. I agree to the Terms of Use and acknowledge that I have read the Privacy Policy . ‚ÄúFortunately, prices are showing an overall downward trend after March‚Äôs peak,‚Äù according to Choi. ‚ÄúIf there are no additional disruptions, we anticipate them stabilizing in the second half of the year as originally forecast, around the low to mid-2 percent range.‚Äù

title: Holidaymakers warned they could miss their flight if they follow viral packing 'hack'
creator: newsdesk@men-news.co.uk (Neil Shaw, Liv Clarke)
description: A chemist has spoken out about online packing tips which could cause your holiday to be delayed
content: Holidaymakers could end up seriously delayed at the airport or missing their flight if they follow a medication packing trend that‚Äôs gone viral on social media, chemists have warned. The hack sees people remove medication from its original packaging and put it in sweet boxes - such as TicTac containers - to save space in luggage, but Mitesh Desai, director at Landys Chemist, has spoken out about the hack videos. Although it may seem like a handy way to save on space, passengers could end up in difficulty at airport security if the medication is not in its original packaging, BristolLive reports . Mitesh said: ‚ÄúWhile swapping your medicine packaging for a smaller container that might take up slightly less space in your luggage, seems like a good idea, there are a few reasons why this isn‚Äôt recommended. ‚ÄúRemoving medication from its original packaging can cause delays at the airport. The lack of identification could raise concerns, with security requiring additional information, delaying or potentially preventing you from boarding your flight. In worst-case scenarios, you may have to discard your medicine. READ MORE: Jet2 and EasyJet warn of 'delays and disruption' this half term "In addition to the hassle of making it through the airport, you could also run the risk of diminishing the effectiveness of your medication by putting it into a different container. Medical packaging is designed to protect medication from interacting with elements such as light, heat, moisture and air, which can degrade the potency of medicine over time. "When you remove your medication‚Äôs original packaging, exposure to external elements can reduce the stability of the medication‚Äôs formulation and contribute to a potential loss of therapeutic benefits.‚Äù Mitesh added: ‚ÄúMedical packaging often incorporates child-resistant features such as anti-twist child locks to prevent accidental ingestion by curious young children who may mistake medicine for a sweet treat. When you remove medicine from its child-resistant packaging, you increase the risk of accidental poisoning or the ingestion of harmful substances by children. This could have fatal consequences.‚Äù The leading chemist said: ‚ÄúSocial media algorithms often show users content that aligns with their existing beliefs and preferences, leading to confirmation bias. If someone already holds certain misconceptions about health and sees them reinforced on social media, they may become more resistant to seeking evidence-based medical advice. "Medical advice from qualified professionals is tailored to every individual's specific health condition, medical history and other relevant factors. Advice from people who aren‚Äôt qualified to give it can do more harm than good because such advice, as well-intentioned as it may be, may not take individual differences into account and can be inappropriate or ineffective to a wider audience.‚Äù Mitesh said different countries will have different rules around medication, adding: ‚ÄúDifferent countries have different rules and regulations about the kind of medication you can or cannot carry with you. Many countries will require you to keep your medication in its original packaging when travelling overseas, ensuring that the label is clear and legible. Medications that are freely available in one country may be classed as controlled substances in other countries. The best way to know what medicines you can or cannot carry abroad is by checking with the embassy of the country you‚Äôre travelling to, who can advise on whether or not you will need to carry your prescription or a personal license and so on.‚Äù For more of today's top stories, click here.

title: Protecting children from human trafficking is focus of Farmington Hills meeting
description: A panel of three experts will give presentations on human trafficking.
content: Two Farmington Hills community organizations will host a presentation next month aimed at protecting children from human trafficking. Farmington SAFE (Suicide Awareness For Everyone) is partnering with CARES (Community-Action-Resources-Empowerment-Services) of Farmington Hills, an organization that helps the disadvantaged. The forum on human trafficking will be held from 11:30 a.m.-2:30 p.m. Saturday, June 8, at the CARES campus, 27835 Shiawassee Road in Farmington Hills. The discussion will focus on the risks, resources, mental health aspects and responses to human trafficking. Related Articles Parents of middle and high school students are encouraged to attend. A light lunch will be available at 11:30 a.m.; the expert presentations will begin at about noon. There will be an opportunity to ask questions. Presenters include: ‚Äì Dr. Tehmina Shakir, psychiatrist and educator, on child trafficking and mental health ‚Äì Elaine Grohman, integrative medicine energy healer, on trusting your feelings and situational awareness ‚Äì Farmington Hills Police Chief Jeff King, on risks and law enforcement recommendations and resources. For more information, visit https://farmingtonsafe.com/ or call 734-834-3156.

title: Siddharth Anand unveils title of his upcoming project with Saif Ali Khan | Deets Inside
description: Filmmaker Siddharth Anand shared a picture with Saif Ali Khan with a caption that read, "Back on set with my first hero! How can nothing change!" The picture put media speculations to rest and confirmed that the filmmaker and actor are set to collaborate after 17 years, which has left the fans excited for the upcoming film. Now, Siddharth has shared a picture of Robbie Grewal and Saif with a caption that seems to be the title of the trio's project together. As per Anand‚Äôs latest Instagram post, the highly anticipated movie will be titled ‚ÄúJewel Thief- The Red Sun Chapter.‚Äù
content: Filmmaker Siddharth Anand shared a picture with with a caption that read, "Back on set with my first hero! How can nothing change!" The picture put media speculations to rest and confirmed that the filmmaker and actor are set to collaborate after 17 years, which has left the fans excited for the upcoming film. Now, Siddharth has shared a picture of Robbie Grewal and Saif with a caption that seems to be the title of the trio's project together. As per Anand‚Äôs latest Instagram post, the highly anticipated movie will be titled ‚ÄúJewel Thief- The Red Sun Chapter.‚Äù Watch the post here: Siddharth is producing the project under 'Marflix Pictures' along with Producer Mamta Anand, while Robbie Grewal is directing it. This combination of producers, directors and actors has set high expectations for the project, which is being touted as a heist drama. The project will also feature Jaideep Ahlawat in a pivotal role. As per reports, the project will focus on the battle between Saif Ali Khan and Jaideep Ahlawat and will be a direct-to-digital release. Siddharth Anand, Mamta Anand, Saif Ali Khan and Robbie Grewal, along with the rest of the cast and crew, are currently shooting for the project in Budapest. While the project marks Robbie and Saif's first collaboration, Khan and Siddharth have previously teamed up for ‚ÄòSalaam Namaste‚Äô and ‚ÄòTa Ra Rum Pum.‚Äô Now, fans are excited to witness what the trio is going to bring on the screens. Meanwhile, on the work front, Saif Ali Khan was last seen in Adipurush. The film also starred Prabhas and . The film was released in 2023. The film reportedly made on a huge budget of Rs 600 crore tanked at the box office despite witnessing one of the biggest opening weekends at the box office. Siddharth Anand's recent film Fighter garnered great numbers at the box office. The film features Hrithik Roshan, , Rishabh Sawhney, Akshay Oberoi, Sanjeeda Sheikh and Karan Singh Grover among others. Before this, the filmmaker collaborated with , Deepika Padukone and for Pathaan.

title: Dell Technologies‚Äô Ed Hicks: Federated Learning Could Help Agencies Advance AI at the Edge
creator: Jane Edwards
description: Ed Hicks, business development manager for federal and artificial intelligence at Dell Technologies (NYSE: DELL), said government agencies that intend to implement AI at the edge should consider adopting federated learning to quickly glean insights from data while ensuring the security of critical data. In an article published on Carahsoft.com, Hicks noted that federated learning
content: , business development manager for federal and artificial intelligence at (NYSE: DELL), said government agencies that intend to implement AI at the edge should consider adopting to quickly glean insights from data while ensuring the security of critical data. In an article published on , Hicks noted that federated learning could enable agencies to leverage larger datasets at a decreased bandwidth. ‚ÄúFederated models require significantly less bandwidth than other models because the information isn‚Äôt being sent back to a data center for processing,‚Äù he wrote. ‚ÄúIf an agency has a rich dataset in the cloud and a small amount of compute at the edge, it can use federated learning to train the edge device without having to move all the data from the cloud.‚Äù Hicks cited some of the key considerations for agencies that plan to apply AI at the edge, including the need to identify the end goal of the AI or a machine learning model. ‚ÄúOther key questions include how much data an agency is trying to process and how quickly it needs the results,‚Äù he added. The Dell Technologies executive discussed how the company works to help agencies that intend to incorporate AI at the edge, such as creating a roadmap for AI implementation, providing federated learning and analytics tools to agencies and finding ways for agencies to make the most of their data. ‚ÄúWe also provided a validated, containerized solution that agencies can use to quickly and easily deploy a federated learning solution in a Kubernetes environment,‚Äù Hicks added. title: Five things to know about the NHL playoffs
creator: The Canadian Press
description: The Florida Panthers promised tonight would be one of those fasten-your-seatbelt playoff games when they look to level their Eastern Conference final series at two games apiece. If the Rangers win they‚Äôll be up 3-1 and in the driver‚Äôs seat heading back to Madison Square Garden. And in Edmonton, the Oilers will have a day [...]
content: The Florida Panthers promised tonight would be one of those fasten-your-seatbelt playoff games when they look to level their Eastern Conference final series at two games apiece. If the Rangers win they‚Äôll be up 3-1 and in the driver‚Äôs seat heading back to Madison Square Garden. And in Edmonton, the Oilers will have a day to figure out how they blew a tire after a fast start against the Stars last night, before trying to tie their West final series at 2-2 tomorrow. Here are five things to know about the NHL playoffs: COMEBACK OR COLLAPSE? Great comeback or a big collapse? That was the question after Edmonton blew a 2-0 lead and lost 5-3 to the visiting Dallas Stars last night. Oilers captain Connor McDavid, who had a goal and assist in the first period at Rogers Place, figured it may have been a bit of both. ‚ÄúThey went up a couple levels and we went down a few levels,‚Äù McDavid said. ‚ÄúYou see the difference.‚Äù The Oilers outshot the Stars 10-3 in the first, outscored, outhit, outhustled and outskated the visitors and led 2-0. Then, the Oilers took their foot off the gas and the Stars, led by Jason Robertson, dominated the second period, outshooting the Oilers 16-7, outscoring them 3-1 and outhustling them for loose pucks. The Oilers have seen this movie before. They blew a late 4-2 lead in Game 1 against the Vancouver Canucks and lost 5-4. The Oilers led Game 7 against the Canucks 3-0 and then desperately scrambled to hang on for a series-clinching 3-2 win. McDavid and defenceman Darnell Nurse said 50-minute efforts don‚Äôt cut it in the post-season. Both promised to be better in Game 4. REPLACEMENTS PLAY BIG ROLE The Replacements, a 2000 sports comedy starring Canadian Keanu Reaves, poked fun at missing players during the 1987 NFL strike. The Replacements 2.0, a true 2024 sports ‚Äúdrama‚Äù starring the Oilers‚Äô Adam Henrique and the Stars‚Äô Roope Hintz, is a real story about the value of injecting skilled players back into the Edmonton-Dallas NHL playoff series. Hintz, who played his first game last night since suffering an upper-body injury in Game 4 of the second-round series against the Colorado Avalanche, assisted on both Jason Robertson goals in the second period. Henrique, who injured his ankle in Game 5 of the opening round against the Los Angeles Kings, scored the Oilers‚Äô third goal in the second period which tied the game 3-3 heading into the intermission. SEGUIN MARKS MILESTONE WITH KEY ASSISTS Tyler Seguin played his 130th playoff game last night and the Stars‚Äô forward did more than just show up. The 32-year-old Seguin, of Brampton, Ont., assisted on Robertson‚Äôs first goal in the second period and then set up Robertson‚Äôs winning goal in the third period. TROUBA HIT WITH ELBOWING FINE New York Rangers‚Äô defenceman and captain Jacob Trouba was fined $5,000 yesterday for Sunday‚Äôs second-period elbowing infraction that levelled Evan Rodrigues of the Florida Panthers. Trouba, now the No. 1 villain in Florida, makes $8 million a year, so the fine is easier to take than a suspension. In fact, Panthers‚Äô bench boss Paul Maurice ‚Äî who coached Trouba in Winnipeg ‚Äî mocked the paltry fine, suggesting reporters pass the hat around so Jake will be able to eat after making the payment. Trouba said the controversial hit ‚Äújust happened fast‚Äù and insisted he wasn‚Äôt targeting Rodrigues‚Äô head. In fact, one New York beat reporter asked the hard-nosed defenceman if the Panthers are guilty of embellishment. Expect the hitting to get cranked up another notch on Tuesday when the host Panthers aim to level the best-of-seven Eastern Conference final at two games apiece. COMEBACK RANGERS IN RECORD BOOKS The Rangers established an NHL record for most comeback victories in the regular season and playoffs combined as they earned their 34th of 2023-24 with Sunday‚Äôs 5-4 overtime victory in Florida. The Blueshirts also matched their franchise record for most overtime wins in a post-season with four. This report by The Canadian Press was first published May 28, 2024.

title: Harry and Meghan waiting for right moment to use Archie and Lilibet to boost Sussex brand
creator: reporters@dailyrecord.co.uk (Sophia Papamavroudi, Nicola Croal)
description: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry are tipped to make a grand debut with their children, Archie, five, and Lilibet, two, but they are waiting for one key thing first.
content: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry are tipped to make a grand debut with their children, Archie, five, and Lilibet, two, but they are waiting for one key thing first. Get the latest entertainment news sent straight to your inbox with our weekly Showbiz newsletter We have more newsletters Get the latest entertainment news sent straight to your inbox with our weekly Showbiz newsletter We have more newsletters Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are expected to introduce their children, five year old Prince Archie and two year old Princess Lilibet, to the world in a grand manner but they're waiting for the right moment, according to a royal expert. The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have largely kept their two young kids away from the public eye but following their recent tour in Nigeria, some royal enthusiasts were hopeful that the couple would include their children in future overseas trips. Royal author Tom Quinn suggests that this is precisely what "proud" parents Harry and Meghan plan to do when the time is right. Quinn believes that Meghan recognises the positive impact that Archie and Lilibet's public appearances could have on the Sussex brand, the Express reports. Speaking to the Mirror, he said: "Harry and Meghan are incredibly proud of their children, and when they are a little older and better able to travel, there is no doubt they will be taken on some of the couple's tours. "Meghan is acutely aware of what a great look this will be, the charming royal couple with their charming royal children will attract the sort of publicity that Harry and Meghan crave, especially now that they are so determined to be billionaire entrepreneurs." However, the expert also noted that such a move could affect the Royal Family. As the Montecito-based couple continue to lead increasingly prominent royal lives, Kate and William may find themselves struggling to keep up. Harry and Meghan have recently returned from a three-day visit to West Africa, where they focused on mental health support for soldiers and youth empowerment as part of the Invictus Games' 10th-anniversary celebrations. The journey has been hailed as a triumph by numerous royal commentators, with some even referring to it as an "unofficial royal tour". During their stay, the couple also hinted at future engagements similar to their Nigerian trip. Speaking to PEOPLE, Harry emphasised the importance of in-person engagement: "It is hugely important for us to meet directly with people, supporting our causes and listening, in order to bring about solutions, support and positive change." He further discussed their upcoming plans, stating: "There's only so much one can do from home and over Zoom, so we look forward to travelling more because the work matters." Harry also mentioned the broader scope of their initiatives: "Whether it's the Archewell Foundation, Invictus or any of our other causes, there will always be reasons to meet the people at the heart of our work."
